intro: Siphocampylus candollei var. breviflorus, commonly known as the short-flowered siphocampylus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like foliage. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
